intro: Daucus grandiflorus, commonly known as the giant parsley or large-flowered parsley, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, celery, and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are finely divided and have a strong, spicy scent, while its white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Daucus grandiflorus is often found in regions with well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
